name: brilliantly
content:
brilliantly adverb
(VERY WELL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 very well, in a way that shows great intelligence or skill or great success: He seems to do everything brilliantly - piano playing, skiing, sailing. The novel brilliantly captures the complex feel of modern life. The ploy worked brilliantly.
More examplesFewer examplesHis book is a brilliantly vivid history of jazz. a brilliantly delivered speechThe product was marketed brilliantly.You've done brilliantly.

brilliantly adverb
(SHINING)
in a way that is very bright or shining very strongly: The sun shone brilliantly. brilliantly coloured bird feathers His robes were brilliantly white.
More examplesFewer examplesThe firelight reflected brilliantly in the crystals decorating her gown.The water of the stream below sparkled brilliantly.The ballroom was brilliantly lit by chandeliers.
